intro: Brickellia lemmonii, commonly known as Lemonade Flower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, with a fuzzy texture that helps reduce water loss. Brickellia lemmonii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
